channel.title: What's New in Auxy 6.6
channel.description:
ðŸ¥³
We are happy to announce that Auxy just got even smoother with the following updates: - Now you can undo and redo changes in the loop editor - Master effects can be disabled in settings - Samples can be rendered as individual files when you export stems - Old renders are now grouped and can be easily deleted if you need to free up space - New scenes are now empty by default, but you can still duplicate an existing scene if you don't want to start blank - The last scene now stays selected when a track ends - On iPhone, you can swipe from the left edge of the screen to close projects - A number of small bug fixes and graphical improvements
If you like the app, it is always helpful if you leave a fresh review in the [App Store](https://itunes.apple.com/app/id1034348186). Looking forward to hear your thoughts and answer any questions below! ðŸ¤—

item.title: What's New in Auxy 6.6
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
Probably (nominally) better to post new feature requests in the Most Wanted Features thread, rather than the thread announcing past new features.

Both are likely being equally ignored by the Auxy team, but at least it keeps things a bit more structured.
(Itâ€™s likely this entire forum is being ignored/abandoned by the Auxy team.)

Most Wanted Features Auxy Feedback
To structure the discussion around new features and bring some more clarity to what weâ€™re working on, I will list the most common requests below (in no particular order) along with some comments. Feel free to ask about more stuff and I will update this initial post as we go along. I have browsed the old feature threads and listed things that I could think of, so please remind me about all the things that I have forgotten! Undo and Robustness A lot of people ask for an undo feature in the app.â€¦

Read full topic

item.title: What's New in Auxy 6.6
item.dc:creator: MetricMusicDivision
item.description:
What about: Waveform Instrument Creator

So what if you want a square wave and JUST A SQUARE WAVETM, you go to Drums and Samples, then select Waveform Instrument. Then, edit the waveform in this cool menu similar to the Pan automation display. After that, you can make that an instrument and stuff.

The customization options for the waveform instrument are really large. For starters, you can select from preset waves, or make your own and save it as a preset! After that, you can do some really epic stuff with it. Check Beepboxâ€™s custom instrument options. Thatâ€™s the options youâ€™ll get in the waveform!

The waveform instrument could revolutionize videogame-style track making as we know it. Thereâ€™s also no reason people like me (aka. demo users) should have this, so itâ€™s another thing to pile onto the things youâ€™ll get by getting the subscription.

Unfortunately, I canâ€™t make good mock-ups, so that will come later on.

The waveform instrument, a must-have/QoL feature for video game track makers.

Read full topic

Never gonna happen bc Auxyâ€™s design ethos is to simplify, not abstract the music production process.

Another reason it wonâ€™t happen is bc there almost certainly wonâ€™t be any further feature/functionality updates to Auxy, just sound packs every now and again â€” though those are becoming less and less likely too.

item.title: What's New in Auxy 6.6
item.dc:creator: ThoughtfulNoise
item.description:
Trust me, no-oneâ€™s getting that feature in Auxy. Ever. Even if the tech was â€˜good enoughâ€™ to sound like more than a cheap and nasty novelty.

(By time the tech is good enough to sound convincing, Auxy will likely already be dead and forgotten.)

Auxy would never build something like that themselvesâ€¦ (click for more details)

Itâ€™s all likely a moot point anyway. I honestly believe that there will be no further feature updates to Auxy (at least, while Lenberg still owns it) â€” which is why Iâ€™d like another company (e.g. Splice) to buy Auxy.

Read full topic

item.title: What's New in Auxy 6.6
item.dc:creator: Auxy
item.description:
Master effects on stems make little sense since they sound a certain way when applied to all the instruments playing together, but very different applied to one stem at a time.

Read full topic

item.title: What's New in Auxy 6.6
item.dc:creator: Cheddr
item.description:
It would save me a ton of time if I could keep the master effects on for stem exports as well. Like a TON of time.

Being able to automate the master channel would be really cool.
